skill.name: context-tools
skill.description: Context management tools for Claude Code - provides intelligent codebase mapping with Python, Rust, and C++ parsing, duplicate detection, and MCP-powered symbol queries. Use this skill when working with large codebases that need automated indexing and context management.

skill.author: ChipFlow

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate context management plugin for Claude Code. It reads project files to generate symbol indexes and manifests, writes to the project's .claude directory, and uses subprocess spawning with resource limits for safe indexing. No network calls, no credential access, no persistence mechanisms beyond project files.

content.value_statement: Claude struggles to understand large codebases without proper structure. This skill provides automatic project mapping, symbol indexing, and duplicate detection so Claude can find functions, classes, and files instantly without slow grep searches.
actual_capabilities: Parses Python, Rust, and C++ code to extract functions, classes, and methods
Generates searchable SQLite index for fast symbol lookups
Detects similar classes and functions that may be duplicates
Creates project manifest with build system and entry points
Stores learnings that persist across sessions
Provides MCP tools for instant symbol search (10-100x faster than grep)
limitations: Only indexes Python, Rust, and C++ source files
Requires uv (Python package manager) to be installed
First-time indexing takes time on large codebases
Does not analyze non-code files like JSON, markdown, or configs

best_practices: Run repo-map after adding new files to keep the index current
Record important discoveries in .claude/learnings.md before session ends
Use MCP tools instead of grep for finding functions and classes
Review similar class/function warnings to identify code duplication
anti_patterns: Using grep/find to search for function names when MCP tools are available
Ignoring the learnings reminder before context compaction
Skipping repo-map regeneration after major refactoring
Running MCP queries without checking if indexing is complete

faq.question: What languages does this support?
faq.answer: Python, Rust, and C++ (.cpp, .cc, .cxx, .hpp, .h, .hxx). Other languages are not parsed.

faq.question: How fast are MCP symbol searches?
faq.answer: MCP tools query a pre-built SQLite index, making them 10-100x faster than grep on large codebases.

faq.question: Does this work with multiple projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Each project has its own .claude/repo-map.db. MCP tools automatically adapt to your current directory.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All data stays local. No network calls are made. Index files are stored only in your project's .claude directory.

faq.question: Why is the first query slow?
faq.answer: On first use, the MCP server indexes your codebase in the background. Subsequent queries return instantly from the SQLite index.

faq.question: How is this different from Search/Grep tools?
faq.answer: Search/Grep scan file contents. MCP tools query a pre-indexed symbol database designed specifically for finding functions, classes, and methods by name.
